trans-unit.source: Track recently used files and folders
trans-unit.target: Track recently used files and folders

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: Important APIs
trans-unit.target: Important APIs

trans-unit.source: MostRecentlyUsedList
trans-unit.target: MostRecentlyUsedList

trans-unit.source: FileOpenPicker
trans-unit.target: FileOpenPicker

trans-unit.source: Track files that your user accesses frequently by adding them to your app's most recently used list (MRU).
trans-unit.target: Track files that your user accesses frequently by adding them to your app's most recently used list (MRU).

trans-unit.source: The platform manages the MRU for you by sorting items based on when they were last accessed, and by removing the oldest item when the list's 25-item limit is reached.
trans-unit.target: The platform manages the MRU for you by sorting items based on when they were last accessed, and by removing the oldest item when the list's 25-item limit is reached.

trans-unit.source: All apps have their own MRU.
trans-unit.target: All apps have their own MRU.

trans-unit.source: Your app's MRU is represented by the [**StorageItemMostRecentlyUsedList**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207475) class, which you obtain from the static [**StorageApplicationPermissions.MostRecentlyUsedList**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207458) property.
trans-unit.target: Your app's MRU is represented by the [**StorageItemMostRecentlyUsedList**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207475) class, which you obtain from the static [**StorageApplicationPermissions.MostRecentlyUsedList**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207458) property.

trans-unit.source: MRU items are stored as [**IStorageItem**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227129) objects, so both [**StorageFile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227171) objects (which represent files) and [**StorageFolder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227230) objects (which represent folders) can be added to the MRU.
trans-unit.target: MRU items are stored as [**IStorageItem**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227129) objects, so both [**StorageFile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227171) objects (which represent files) and [**StorageFolder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227230) objects (which represent folders) can be added to the MRU.

trans-unit.source: **Note** Also see the [File picker sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619994) and the [File access sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619995).
trans-unit.target: **Note** Also see the [File picker sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619994) and the [File access sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619995).

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Understand async programming for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps
trans-unit.target: Understand async programming for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps

trans-unit.source: You can learn how to write asynchronous apps in C\# or Visual Basic, see [Call asynchronous APIs in C\# or Visual Basic](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt187337).
trans-unit.target: You can learn how to write asynchronous apps in C\# or Visual Basic, see [Call asynchronous APIs in C\# or Visual Basic](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt187337).

trans-unit.source: To learn how to write asynchronous apps in C++, see [Asynchronous programming in C++](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt187334).
trans-unit.target: To learn how to write asynchronous apps in C++, see [Asynchronous programming in C++](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt187334).

trans-unit.source: Access permissions to the location
trans-unit.target: Access permissions to the location

trans-unit.source: See [File access permissions](file-access-permissions.md).
trans-unit.target: See [File access permissions](file-access-permissions.md).

trans-unit.source: Open files and folders with a picker
trans-unit.target: Open files and folders with a picker

trans-unit.source: Picked files are often the same files that users return to again and again.
trans-unit.target: Picked files are often the same files that users return to again and again.

trans-unit.source: Add a picked file to the MRU
trans-unit.target: Add a picked file to the MRU

trans-unit.source: The files that your user picks are often files that they return to repeatedly.
trans-unit.target: The files that your user picks are often files that they return to repeatedly.

trans-unit.source: So consider adding picked files to your app's MRU as soon as they are picked.
trans-unit.target: So consider adding picked files to your app's MRU as soon as they are picked.

trans-unit.source: Here's how.
trans-unit.target: Here's how.

trans-unit.source: [**StorageItemMostRecentlyUsedList.Add**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207476) is overloaded.
trans-unit.target: [**StorageItemMostRecentlyUsedList.Add**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207476) is overloaded.

trans-unit.source: In the example, we use [**Add(IStorageItem, String)**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207481) so that we can associate metadata with the file.
trans-unit.target: In the example, we use [**Add(IStorageItem, String)**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207481) so that we can associate metadata with the file.

trans-unit.source: Setting metadata lets you record the item's purpose, for example "profile pic".
trans-unit.target: Setting metadata lets you record the item's purpose, for example "profile pic".

trans-unit.source: You can also add the file to the MRU without metadata by calling [**Add(IStorageItem)**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207480).
trans-unit.target: You can also add the file to the MRU without metadata by calling [**Add(IStorageItem)**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207480).

trans-unit.source: When you add an item to the MRU, the method returns a uniquely identifying string, called a token, which is used to retrieve the item.
trans-unit.target: When you add an item to the MRU, the method returns a uniquely identifying string, called a token, which is used to retrieve the item.

trans-unit.source: **Tip** You'll need the token to retrieve an item from the MRU, so persist it somewhere.
trans-unit.target: **Tip** You'll need the token to retrieve an item from the MRU, so persist it somewhere.

trans-unit.source: For more info about app data, see [Managing application data](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh465109).
trans-unit.target: For more info about app data, see [Managing application data](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh465109).

trans-unit.source: Use a token to retrieve an item from the MRU
trans-unit.target: Use a token to retrieve an item from the MRU

trans-unit.source: Use the retrieval method most appropriate for the item you want to retrieve.
trans-unit.target: Use the retrieval method most appropriate for the item you want to retrieve.

trans-unit.source: Retrieve a file as a [**StorageFile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227171) by using [**GetFileAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207486).
trans-unit.target: Retrieve a file as a [**StorageFile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227171) by using [**GetFileAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207486).

trans-unit.source: Retrieve a folder as a [**StorageFolder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227230) by using [**GetFolderAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207489).
trans-unit.target: Retrieve a folder as a [**StorageFolder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227230) by using [**GetFolderAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207489).

trans-unit.source: Retrieve a generic [**IStorageItem**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227129), which can represent either a file or folder, by using [**GetItemAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207492).
trans-unit.target: Retrieve a generic [**IStorageItem**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227129), which can represent either a file or folder, by using [**GetItemAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207492).

trans-unit.source: Here's how to get back the file we just added.
trans-unit.target: Here's how to get back the file we just added.

trans-unit.source: Here's how to iterate all the entries to get tokens and then items.
trans-unit.target: Here's how to iterate all the entries to get tokens and then items.

trans-unit.source: The [**AccessListEntryView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227349) lets you iterate entries in the MRU.
trans-unit.target: The [**AccessListEntryView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227349) lets you iterate entries in the MRU.

trans-unit.source: These entries are [**AccessListEntry**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227348) structures that contain the token and metadata for an item.
trans-unit.target: These entries are [**AccessListEntry**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227348) structures that contain the token and metadata for an item.

trans-unit.source: Removing items from the MRU when it's full
trans-unit.target: Removing items from the MRU when it's full

trans-unit.source: When the MRU's 25-item limit is reached and you try to add a new item, the item that was accessed the longest time ago is automatically removed.
trans-unit.target: When the MRU's 25-item limit is reached and you try to add a new item, the item that was accessed the longest time ago is automatically removed.

trans-unit.source: So, you never need to remove an item before you add a new one.
trans-unit.target: So, you never need to remove an item before you add a new one.

trans-unit.source: Future-access list
trans-unit.target: Future-access list

trans-unit.source: As well as an MRU, your app also has a future-access list.
trans-unit.target: As well as an MRU, your app also has a future-access list.

trans-unit.source: By picking files and folders, your user grants your app permission to access items that might not be accessible otherwise.
trans-unit.target: By picking files and folders, your user grants your app permission to access items that might not be accessible otherwise.

trans-unit.source: If you add these items to your future-access list then you'll retain that permission when your app wants to access those items again later.
trans-unit.target: If you add these items to your future-access list then you'll retain that permission when your app wants to access those items again later.

trans-unit.source: Your app's future-access list is represented by the [**StorageItemAccessList**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207459) class, which you obtain from the static [**StorageApplicationPermissions.FutureAccessList**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207457) property.
trans-unit.target: Your app's future-access list is represented by the [**StorageItemAccessList**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207459) class, which you obtain from the static [**StorageApplicationPermissions.FutureAccessList**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207457) property.

trans-unit.source: When a user picks an item, consider adding it to your future-access list as well as your MRU.
trans-unit.target: When a user picks an item, consider adding it to your future-access list as well as your MRU.

trans-unit.source: The [**FutureAccessList**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207457) can hold up to 1000 items.
trans-unit.target: The [**FutureAccessList**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207457) can hold up to 1000 items.

trans-unit.source: Remember: it can hold folders as well as files, so that's a lot of folders.
trans-unit.target: Remember: it can hold folders as well as files, so that's a lot of folders.

trans-unit.source: The platform never removes items from the [**FutureAccessList**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207457) for you.
trans-unit.target: The platform never removes items from the [**FutureAccessList**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207457) for you.

trans-unit.source: When you reach the 1000-item limit, you can't add another until you make room with the [**Remove**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207497) method.
trans-unit.target: When you reach the 1000-item limit, you can't add another until you make room with the [**Remove**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207497) method.
